job description:
Job Location: Hershey, PA

The BI & Analytics Enterprise Data Science team within Hershey Information Systems provides exciting opportunities to innovate in a fast-paced team that contributes to game-changing projects and transformational technologies. As a data scientist in the Enterprise Data Science team, you'll partner with technology and business partners to build new, machine-intelligent capabilities that impact the business. You will work with large volumes of data, innovative technologies and advanced methods to solve real-world problems. You'll design and run experiments, research new algorithms, and find new ways of optimizing risk, profitability, and customer experience.

Applicants should have a background in machine learning, statistical modeling, feature discovery/selection, optimization, exploratory data analysis, data mining and pattern recognition.

Primary responsibilities:
  • Interact with customers directly to understand the business problem, help and aid them in implementation of ML/DL algorithms to solve problems
  • As part of a team, use machine learning, deep learning and other analytical techniques to create scalable solutions for business problems
  • Demonstrate understanding of forecasting, optimization, statistical analysis and operations research. Extensive knowledge of forecasting techniques such as trend analysis, econometric models and machine learning is preferred
  • Design, develop and evaluate highly innovative models for predictive learning, content ranking, and anomaly detection
  • Analyze and extract relevant information from historical data to help automate and optimize key processes
  • Work closely with technology, business and engineering teams to drive model implementations and adoption of new algorithms.
Experience:
  • +2 years of experience working with R & Python
  • +2 years of professional experience or relevant coursework/projects
  • +2 years of relevant experience building large scale machine learning or deep learning models and/or systems
  • +1 years of experience building, training, scoring, tuning and maintaining predictive models
  • +1 years of experience with large-scale data storage processing architectures (Hadoop, HIVE, Spark/SparkR, etc.)
  • Experience building models with frameworks like MXNet, TensorFlow, Caffe, TORCH, theano or similar a plus
  • Experience with deep learning (e.g., CNN, RNN, LSTM) a plus
Qualifications:
  • Masters degree with STEM focus required, Ph.D. welcome to apply
  • Strong working knowledge of deep learning, machine learning and statistics
  • Familiarity with agile methodology
  • Strong communication skills (written & oral)
  • Comfortable working in a fast paced, highly collaborative, dynamic work environment
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Ability to think creatively and solve problems
  • Startup mindset & innovative thinker
